Receiver reply payload: 2 bytes (ADC val byte 1, ADC val byte 2)

Vmax*4 bytes - [actuator_direct_adc_measurement byte 1, actuator_direct_adc_measurement byte 2, actuator_indirect_adc_measurement byte 1, actuator_indirect_adc_measurement byte 2]*4096 values (ADC measurements per DAC level)
3 Bytes: (Current state; Current coase Z offset measurement byte 1; Current coase Z offset measurement byte 2)
6 bytes (ADC Amplitude byte1, ADC Amplitude byte2, DAC Z Offset byte1, DAC Z Offset byte2, ADC PHASE byte1, ADC PHASE byte2)
Remark: read DAC8 and ADC5 and Phase

Send payload: (setpoint byte1, setpoint byte2, tolerance byte1, tolerance byte2)
Receiver reply payload: 1 or 3 byte (‘o’, Zcoarse byte1, Zcoarse byte2) OR (‘f’)

Send payload: Send 16 messages of 256 bytes (256=PAGE_SIZE/2) in length to load the 4096*2byte 1D DAC Table grid array.
(val1 byte 1, val1 byte 2, val2 byte 1, val2 byte 2)
11 bytes (‘@’, vmin_line byte 1, vmin_line byte2, vmin_scan byte 1, vmin_scan byte 2, vmax byte 1, vmax byte 2, numpts byte 1, numpts byte 2, numlines byte 1, numlines byte 2)
5 bytes (ratio enum byte, numpoints byte #1, numpoints byte #2, numlines byte#1, numlines byte#2)

Receiver reply payload: NumPts*4 bytes (Amp1 byte 1, Amp1 byte 2, Phase1 byte 1, Phase1 byte 2, etc…)
NumPts*4 bytes (val1 byte 1, val1 byte 2, val2 byte 1, val2 byte 2, etc…) amp and phase
8 points of 6 bytes each: (z_amp_adc byte 1, z_amp_adc byte 2, z_offset_adc byte 1, z_offset_adc byte 2,  z_phase_adc byte 1, z_phase_adc byte 2))
8 points of 6 bytes each: (z_amp_adc byte 1, z_amp_adc byte 2, z_offset_adc byte 1, z_offset_adc byte 2,  z_phase_adc byte 1, z_phase_adc byte 2))
3 bytes (DAC#, DAC val byte 1, DAC val byte 2)

Send payload: (startf byte1, startf byte2, increment byte1, increment byte2, numpts byte1, numpts byte2)
(Fstart LSB low, Fstart LSB high, Fstart MSB low, Fstart MSB high, increment LSB, increment MSB, numpts LSB, numpts MSB)
Remark: Send data to set for dds AD9837

Send payload: microsteps byte Enum: 0: full steps, 1: 2 microsteps, 2: 4 microsteps, 3: 8; 4: 16; 5: 32 microsteps
(Speed byte1, Speed byte2). Very slow 0x0000 (DEC0) to Very fast 0x66BC (DEC26300)

Remark: MCU sends this ID when it receives a command it does not recognize. Check firmware/client version.
